definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: Wilhelmina: I will need a talented seamstress.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一個有才能的女裁縫師。

sentences.english: The little tailor stepped up and bowed.
Then i had a long session of tailoring in the changing room with, of course the tailor.
sentences.chinese: 然後我和裁縫在試衣間花了很長時間改衣服。

sentences.english: The seamstress bound the hem of the dress with a ruffle.
sentences.chinese: 女裁縫用褶襉飾邊給女上衣鑲邊。

sentences.english: The tailor took the students' measures for their new suits.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫給學生量尺寸做了他們的新西服。

sentences.english: Yesterday, I decided to get my pants altered .
sentences.chinese: 昨天，我決定往裁縫店改褲子。

sentences.english: My grandmother was an expert dressmaker.
Tailors may make clothes to your own measure.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫可以給人量體載衣。

sentences.english: The tailor stitched the split seam in seconds.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫一會兒工夫就把破縫縫好了。

sentences.english: The tailor made a suit for the boy out of the odds and ends of the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 裁縫用剩餘的布頭給孩子做了一套衣服。

sentences.english: I was wandering along the street when I caught sight of a tailor's shop.
sentences.chinese: 我正沿着大街徘徊，這時我看到一家裁縫鋪。

sentences.english: After that I tried to be a tailor, but I just wasn't suited for it.
sentences.chinese: 後來我學做裁縫，但我並不適合這份工作。

sentences.english: "Let me be your apprentice, " said the boy, and the tailor agreed.
Interestingly, however, those tailors are themselves divided.
sentences.chinese: 但有趣的是，裁縫界對此也是意見不一。

sentences.english: The little dressmaker bought an envelope of nasturtium seeds at the florists.
sentences.chinese: 那個個子矮小的女裁縫在花鋪裏買了一包金蓮花種子。

definition: passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
master/qualified worker/respectful form of address for older men/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
to make to order/to have sth made to order
paper pattern as model in dressmaking/paper patten
